Authors:
Katherine Taylor, Vera Andjic, Paul A. Barber, Giles E.
St.J. Hardy, Treena I Burgess
Title:
New species of Teratosphaeria associated with leaf diseases
on Corymbia calophylla (Marri)
Keywords:
Quambalaria, tree decline, taxonomy, phylogeny,
Teratosphaeria australiensis
Abstract:
Corymbia calophylla is an important, eucalypt species
endemic to the south west of Western Australia. It is currently in
decline across its native habitat due, perhaps driven partially by
climate change but also by the presence of a new canker diseases caused
by Quambalaria coyrecup. Few fungal leaf pathogens have been described
from C. calophylla. The following paper describes two new species of
Teratosphaeria from C. calophylla, Teratosphaeria calophylla sp. nov and
T. rubidae sp. nov.
